dialogues.text: (hysterically) You're lying to me, Doctor! The baby's worse; that's why you ordered the oxygen. She reaches for the door-knob and the doctor stops her, grabbing hold of her. Mrs. Mason comes into the scene fro the waiting room. The doctor and Mrs. Mason try to soothe Jane and her hysteria mounts. The doctor takes hold of on of Jane's arms and Mrs. Mason the other.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MASON
dialogues.text: Jane, dear -- Jane -- please...

dialogues.speaker: DR. HEALY
dialogues.text: The oxygen's only to help him till the serum gets here.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (hysterically) You're lying to me! CAMERA TRUCKS with them as they lead her forcibly away fr the baby's room toward the waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HEALY
dialogues.text: I want you to lie down and rest -- I'll give you something to make you sleep. Will you do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (hysterically) Oh, Doctor Healy -- I couldn't! Please don't make me! They stop at the entrance of the waiting room. Jane takes hold of herself and with a powerful effort, controls her  hysteria.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Doctor -- I'm all right now. (pleadingly) When can I see him?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HEALY
dialogues.text: In a little while. He exits back to baby's room; CAMERA PANS with Jane as sh goes to the window seat, sinks to the floor and looks out the beating rain of the night. Mrs. Mason comes into the Shot and looks pityingly down at the wretched, forlorn fi

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (after a second or two) If my baby dies, I want to die, too.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MASON
dialogues.text: (sympathetically) I know, dear, I know... But you mustn't feel that way. You mustn't let John know you feel that way... He loves the baby too... (there is a very slight choke in her throat) Almost as much as he loves you.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Poor Johnny... He'll be so lonely if the baby -- She can't bring herself to say, "dies."

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MASON
dialogues.text: (simply) He'll have you, Jane... And you'll have him... (Jane makes no comment. Mrs. Mason continues) And you can't be lonely... either of you... as long as you have each other... (she looks away) Do you know when you're really lonely? It's when you have no one to share  things with... not even a loss... (she can't go further in her revelation)

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (turns slowly -- seeing her mother-in-law for the first time) Oh, Mother -- you're lonely... aren't you? Mrs. Mason turns away. There is a silence. Jane goes to h sympathetically, almost forgetting her own grief for a mo

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MASON
dialogues.text: I wasn't -- always -- a bitter old woman... I wasn't always a pest and a nuisance... (she breaks) ...not when I had someone to share things with. Jane takes her into her arms, and now Jane comforts her, whose front breaks, and who sobs against Jane.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MASON
dialogues.text: (muffled) And now the baby... Oh, my baby's baby...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (the tears rolling down her cheeks) Oh, Mother, Mother... And on a tableau of Jane devotedly and heart-brokenly comforting her old mother-in-law, whose head is on Jane's shoulder, Jane's arm around her, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is making its way over a vista of snow-capped mountain peaks.

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: The storm seems to be increasing in violence causing the ship to roll from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is worried, reaches for the radio transmitter and yell into the mouthpiece. His voice cannot be heard over the r of the motor and the howling wind. Conway shakes his head, getting over that he gets no resp His radio is evidently out of commission. He takes off th head-set -- glances at the instrument board.

dialogues.speaker: ALTIMETER
dialogues.text: Needle registers 13,500 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at serum package, takes off his glove and feels package to make sure it hasn't frozen.

dialogues.speaker: SERUM PACKAGE
dialogues.text: It is marked "RUSH - AVOID FREEZING." Conway's hand feels the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied that the serum is okay he starts to write on a that is strapped to his leg between knee and thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conway writes: "6:40 A. M. Radio dead. Fighting for altitude. Terrific d draft. Forc--" A sudden lurch of the plane snaps the lead in the pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he grabs the quivering joystick -- fights vainly to co the plane.

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: Starts to lose altitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needle going down.

dialogues.speaker: PLANE IN LONG DOWN DRAFT
dialogues.text: A thrilling shot of the plane going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting joystick. He looks over side of plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diving at rugged snow covered cliffs, the ground appearin to come closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling to control the plane. The snow and mist gettin heavier.

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: The wheels touch the ground and for an instant it looks a if all were over. With a roar of the motor the plane zoom up.

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: It fails to gain altitude and continues down and down unt it is completely lost in the swirling snow and mist. Hold snow-filled screen a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Rain is beating against the window behind him. He is talk into his instrument.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Denver calling Commercial NC 24.  Come in, Conway. (ANXIOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in! (waits -- no answer comes -- he speaks again with increasing anxiety) Can't you read me, Conway? Can't you read me? Come in, Conway. (still no answer; turns dial; shakes his head in despair -- in dead, hopeless voice) Denver calling Newark. Do you read me, Newark?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF RADIO OPERATOR
dialogues.text: -- at his instrument board. CAMERA DRAWS BACK to reveal behind the Newark chief opera the chief of operators at Newark airport (Superintendent) the assistant radio operator, Judge Doolittle and Johnny. The two latter are listening with suppressed excitement.

dialogues.speaker: DENVER OPERATOR'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (coming from instrument) Still can't contact Conway. Storm increasing over the Rockies. Denver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He registers apprehension as he listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worried, he unfolds his arms.

dialogues.speaker: NEWARK SUPERINTENDENT
dialogues.text: (quietly, in flat voice, controlling his fears) Send out an emergency to all stations. Stand by to contact Conway.

dialogues.speaker: NORTH PLATTE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: North Platte, Nebraska calling Conway -- Commercial NC 24. Do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: OMAHA OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Conway NC 24. This is Omaha. Do you read me, Conway?

dialogues.speaker: CHICAGO OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Chicago calling Commercial NC 24... Conway can you read me? Can't you answer, Conway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One ranger is in uniform and is at the telephone. Another gazing out a window in b.g., against which snow is striki The latter is peering through binoculars. A pair of dripp skiis stand against the walls beside the man at the phone

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: (into phone; shakes his head) No, we haven't seen or heard a plane all day. Sorry, but there's no use sending searching parties out in this blizzard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading: "All Hope Gone For Mercy Plane."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped, but it is a dark dreary day and the lights of the hospital are turned on. A nurse sits by the bedside. OPEN ON CLOSE SHOT OF THE BABY in his small bed covered w the oxygen tent. He breathes with great difficulty. CAMER PANS AROUND to show Dr. Healy crossing the room with his stethoscope in his hand, making his way to the bed. CAMER FOLLOWS DR. HEALY until he passes in front of Jane, then HOLDS ON JANE and we see her looking fixedly at the small bed, stark pain in her eyes. Sister Madelaine stands besi her. BIG HEAD CLOSE UP - DOCTOR HEALY - the earphones over his ears. As he listens gravely to the irregular heartbeats of the baby; and we hear them faintly on the sound track.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Her hand goes to her breast in a mute gesture of agony as she watches. In a low voice she gives expression to the o thought that has been racking through her head for hours.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (a tired whisper) Oh, if there was just something I could do... If there was just something... Sister Madelaine moves closer, puts her hand gently on Ja shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SISTER MADELAINE
dialogues.text: (simply) There is... Come with me. She takes Jane's arm. CAMERA TRUCKS WITH THEM as they lea the room and start down the corridor together.

dialogues.speaker: AT CHAPEL DOORS
dialogues.text: Sister Madelaine opens the doors. Jane looks in and sees chapel.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (turns to Sister Madelaine) Sister Madelaine, I'm not a Catholic --

dialogues.speaker: SISTER MADELAINE
dialogues.text: (shakes her head slightly) That doesn't matter. Jane steps into the chapel. Sister Madelaine softly close the chapel doors behind her. CAMERA TRUCKS IN FRONT of Jane as she walks down toward t altar.

dialogues.speaker: SECTION OF CHAPEL
dialogues.text: Taking in the altar -- the lit candles, the figure of Jes Jane comes into Shot and looks uncertainly about. She stu the figure of Jesus a moment in silence. She hesitates, t sinks to her knees before the figure and with her head bo mutters to herself, shaking her head. She lifts her face the figure.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Shooting down from above and behind the silhouetted figur of Jesus, only Jane's face lighted by the candlelight.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (stumbling to find the right words) You know how much he means to Johnny

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and me... we've only had him such a little while... Oh God, dear, dear God, please... We do want to see him grow up and be a man. Please help our little baby... we love him so... he's so small and helpless... he can't do anything for himself... and we can't seem to do anything. for him... (she clasps her hands and speaks imploringly) Please -- Please -- Please...

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: Starting with shot only of gray fog and clouds and sound roaring plane motor. Then plane emerges from behind cloud into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is worried -- reaches for a map and with a flash light tries to find something he can recognize on the map --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Conway's flash light shining on it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO CONWAY
dialogues.text: He is frantic, realizing he is lost. He puts the map and flash light away and looks over side of plane to see if t is a hole in the clouds that he might get through -- then almost instinctively, nervously reaches for a cigarette. Suddenly a few drops of oil spatter the windshield of the plane. He peers over the side, alarmed, and oil sprays on his goggles. As he pushes his goggles back and wipes his face,

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: With a cloud of smoke pouring out behind. The plane is catching fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantically pulls out his flash light, prepares to bail o picks up the box of serum and sticks it under his jacket and jumps.

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: Parachute and plane falling. The plane now spurting flame The parachute disappears into the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Healy, showing the signs of strain and weariness, stands in the office drinking from a coffee cup. A unifor nurse stands before him.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Shall I order another tank of oxygen, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: DR. HEALY
dialogues.text: (shrugs in despair) If the serum isn't here in a couple of hours... He turns toward the door as he hears sound of footsteps i the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defeated figure of Johnny passes the doorway. His coa collar is turned up around his ears.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Lying stretched out, with pillows under her head, on the window seat. She tosses her head slowly and restlessly. W hold on her long enough to allow for Johnny's walk down t hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny enters. Jane turns, sees him.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (almost listlessly) Hello, Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Hello, Jane. (he crosses over and kneels beside her)

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Looking at Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Looking at Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny gently strokes her hair. He speaks with a strange, new-found serenity.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: We'll always be together, Jane -- no matter what happens -- like this, always. He continues stroking her hair, and we hold on this a mom then.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER BRANCHES OF A TREE
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS DOWN the tattered chute to the body of Conway limply sprawled out on the wet ground. We hold for a mome CAMERA MOVES UP to a CLOSER SHOT. We hold a moment on his motionless figure, then we see the body stir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face is scratched and filthy. He opens his eyes, lift himself up with a grimace of pain. He stares for a moment his left foot, then starts to disengage the harness of th chute. He remembers something and sticks his right hand frantically on the inside of his coat. His hand comes out with the package of serum. It is safe. He manages a grin through his pain and puts it back inside his coat. He loo around, tries to get to his feet, and realizes he can't w His leg is broken. CAMERA TRUCKS WITH HIM as he starts to crawl along the muddy field through the fog.

dialogues.speaker: CONWAY
dialogues.text: Crawling along the field. As his body is lost in the fog,

dialogues.speaker: FARMHOUSE
dialogues.text: The farmhouse stands alone. Conway's figure is dimly seen his knees knocking at the door. From o.s., the sound of a dog barking.  A light goes on in an upstairs window.

dialogues.speaker: AT DOOR
dialogues.text: Conway on his knees before the door, pounding on it with knuckles. From o.s., the sound of the dog barking. The do opens and a sleepy, bewildered farmer with an overcoat ov his full-length underwear in which he has undoubtedly bee sleeping is seen. Behind him, carrying a kerosene lamp, i the farmer's wife with a shabby robe over her nightgown.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: Who are you? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: CONWAY
dialogues.text: I'm hurt. Will you help me?

dialogues.speaker: FARMER'S WIFE
dialogues.text: Mercy sakes alive. Farmer and his wife go to Conway, half lift him up and dr him over the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer and his wife helping Conway into the room. They st frightened, and bewildered at the strange figure they hav let in out of the night.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: What is it -- what's happened?

dialogues.speaker: CONWAY
dialogues.text: Never mind that -- what place is this?

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: Liberty Corners.

dialogues.speaker: CONWAY
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: Thirty-five miles from New York. Suddenly Conway sways and his eyes close. He falls to the floor in a dead faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for mercy sakes alive. The farmer drops to his knees beside Conway. He turns the unconscious form over and looks down into Conway's face. Suddenly the farmer catches sight of the package of serum which is protruding from the open front of Conway's flyin suit. The farmer pulls the package out and stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: (reading the label) St. Francis Hospital, New York City. Rush. The significance of the package dawns on him. He rises an hurries to the telephone. The phone is an old fashioned one, used only in rural districts. The farmer turns the handle and the bell rings the signal for the operator; he then takes down the recei and speaks.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello -- hello -- operator, I want the St. Francis Hospital, New York City. (he glances toward the weird looking body of Conway, turns back to the phone) And reverse the charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrapping being torn off and the box opened, exposing vials of serum.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The name: DR. HEALY flashing on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the baby's wrist -- taking his pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- being filled with fluid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open and Johnny comes out, turns to look back into the baby's room for a moment, then starts off d the long corridor at a run. He reaches the door to the waiting room and throws it ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane is sitting near the window, asleep, worn out with wo and strain. She hears Johnny coming in and wakes up with start. Jane looks at Johnny -- a silent question in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (tenderly -- joyfully Happy New Year, darling. Jane only stares at him, then the significance of the wor strikes her. She goes into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (hysterically) Happy New Year -- Happy New Year -- Over her hysterical laughter,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Healy, Judge Doolittle, Ed Conway, the pilot who brou the serum. Conway's left leg is stiff and he leans on a c CAMERA PICKS UP our trio as the three lift their glasses and slug down their drinks, then set the empty glasses do on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smacking his lips) Well, gentlemen, I guess four's about enough on a business day.

dialogues.speaker: CONWAY
dialogues.text: That's all very well, Joe -- but isn't it about time you bought one?

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE DOOLITTLE
dialogues.text: (flips open his coat) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: CONWAY
dialogues.text: (speaks into mouthpiece) Conway calling Doolittle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We read first only the old firm name of:

dialogues.speaker: DOOLITTLE, MESSERSCHMIDT, DOOLITTLE, HUTCH
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS DOWN to CLOSE UP the remainder of firm name w now reads:

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: And there are certain things, gentlemen, that I want distinctly understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DRAWS BACK to reveal Johnny pacing before the two brothers. He is orating great guns. At his desk, Doolittl is seated, and standing behind him are several other memb of the staff, which include the hitherto nebulous, Messerschmidt, Hutch and the other Doolittle. They are al watching and listening to Johnny with the greatest respec and attention. It is obvious that Johnny is now the fair- haired boy of the firm.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Now, I called this meeting of all the partners in order to make my position clear once and for all. That before I accept your offer of partnership in the firm of -- INTERCUT CLOSE UPS of each member of the firm as Johnny c their names.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: -- Doolittle -- Messerschmidt -- Doolittle -- Hutch -- and Carter, you must know that I consider the methods of this firm at the present time old-fashioned, self-satisfied, high-handed and thoroughly inefficient. Carter, who has been leaning against the wall, straighten up and addresses Doolittle.

dialogues.speaker: CARTER
dialogues.text: It seems to me --

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE DOOLITTLE
dialogues.text: (sharply) Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: And I demand that they be changed -- effective immediately. There is a loud knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE DOOLITTLE
dialogues.text: (frowns and calls out) Come in!

dialogues.speaker: AT DOOR
dialogues.text: It opens and John Horace Mason, II, walks in on his own p An instant later, Jane and Mrs. Mason come in, bursting w news.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I hope we haven't interrupted anything important -- Johnny comes into scene, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Jane --

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Johnny, I know Judge Doolittle won't mind -- CAMERA ANGLE WIDENS as Judge Doolittle and the others, co into the scene.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: We just couldn't wait --

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MASON
dialogues.text: We had to rush down the minute it happened!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: The baby can TALK! She drops down on her knees by the baby and takes hold of his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (to the baby) They don't believe us! Come on, darling -- we'll prove it to them! The men in the office crowd around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- beaming with pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faces of the men behind Johnny. They wait expectantly

dialogues.speaker: JANE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Show them, darling! Don't be afraid -- speak up -- say Daddy! Say Daddy -- please, darling -- say Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking coyly up at the group around him. He

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (pleadingly) Say Daddy! D--D--D -- Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just looking.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE DOOLITTLE
dialogues.text: Say Daddy -- say Daddy --

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Come on, Johnny. Say Daddy -- Say Daddy --

dialogues.speaker: BABY
dialogues.text: Ma-ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they flip back their coats to hear better.

dialogues.speaker: DOOLITTLE BROTHERS
dialogues.text: (together) What?

dialogues.speaker: THE END
dialogues.text: says nothing.
